alert.note: Alert for Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 16 at 11:06AM EDT until further notice by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Marquette MI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Michigan... Michigamme River near Republic affecting Marquette County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Michigamme River near Republic. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 7.7 feet, Water begins to impact the yards of homes near Bengtson bridge on County Road LI in South Republic * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:41 AM EDT Sunday the stage was 9.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:41 AM EDT Sunday was 9.7 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.7 feet on 05/04/2013. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 1000 PM EDT.
